meanings.definition: To cover (a roof or building) with new shingles.
meanings.sent1: The roofers will reshingles our house next week.
meanings.sent2: It is important to reshingles the roof before the rainy season.
meanings.sent3: After the storm, the roof decided it was time for a makeover and asked to be reshingled.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays were like tiny hammers reshingling the roof with warmth.
meanings.sent5: The sound of reshingling echoed through the neighborhood, signaling a fresh start.

meanings.definition: To replace or repair shingles on a roof.
meanings.sent1: We need to reshingles the damaged area of the roof.
meanings.sent2: The roofers will reshingles the broken shingles tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The shingles on the roof were having a party, but the damaged ones were left out until they got reshingled.
meanings.sent4: Her smile reshingles the broken pieces of my heart.
meanings.sent5: The old shingles sighed in relief as the new ones reshingled their place on the roof.
